item.value: The city with the largest population is Shanghai in China. It has almost 14 million inhabitants.
The Sputnik 1, launched on October 4, 1957 by Russia, was the first human-made object to orbit the Earth.
The most widely spoken language is Mandarin, nearly 1 billion people speak it, mainly in China.
The shortfin Mako shark is the fastest fish, it can swim at 50 kilometres per hour. Olympic gold-medal swimmers could not escape even if they tried, they can only swim at 8 kph (5 mph) .
The Universe is about 14 billion years old. The earth is only 4.6 billion years old.
Drinking too much water too quickly can lead to water intoxication which causes an imbalance of water in the brain
English is the second most spoken language in the world.
The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean in the world. It covers about 1/3 of its surface. It is 155.557 million sq km.
The moon orbits the Earth every 27.32 days
The world's oldest person was Kama Chinen. She lived in the Japanese island of Okinawa. She died a week before her 115th birthday. She was born on May 10, 1895.
House flies have a lifespan of two weeks.
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first powered, sustained, and controlled flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903. In 1919 the First transatlantic flight was made.
On April 30, 1789, George Washington became the first President of the United States.
The Universe is about 14 billion years old. The earth is young in comparison, it is only 4.6 billion years old.
The world's population grows by over 100 million each year.
The Sun is one of about 200 billion stars in the Milky Way galaxy. The most current estimates guess that there are 100 to 200 billion galaxies in the Universe
The tallest woman was Zeng Jinlian. She was 2.48 meters ( 8ft 2in ) tall.
In 1783 Sebastien Lenormand was first to demonstrate the parachute. In Missouri 1912, Captain Berry was the first to jump from a plane with a parachute.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
On April 30, 1789, George Washington became the first President of the United States.
